headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; DECLINE IN CONSOLS. By the American Telegraph Co.'s Linca--Office No. 21 Wall-Street. Particulars of the Frightful Massacres at Cawnpore. Defeat of the Mutinecrs and Suicide of Nena Sahib. ARRIVAL OF THE JURA. ARRIVAL OF THE JURA. IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. DESPERATE FOGJTOMG BEFORE DELHI.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard-screw steamship Jura, chartered by the British Covernment to convey the 76th Regiment to England, arrived at this port at 9:40 A. M. to-day. She left Cork on the 17th inst., five days subsequent to the Canada'sdeparture from Liverpool, and should have brought four days' later news from England and the continent.

docs.lead_paragraph: The undersigned has read with the most painful emotions of the loss of the steamer central America, and sincerely deplores the sad rate of her passengers suddenly cut off, "in health and hope." by one of those fearful hurricanes which in the past few years have made so many hearths desolate, and so many hearts to mourn.
